_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Policy: Effingham Equity is committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  Our prevention program includes the use of proper equipment, regular maintenance, inspections and training for all employees that work with the material.  Should an accidental release occur, the facility has oriented the local fire department as well as the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC).  These steps have been taken to assure a quick response to any release and minimize the impact of the release in our community and environment.



Facility Information:  The primary activity at the facility is the storage of anhydrous ammonia for sale to farmers.  Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored and distributed for direct application as a crop production nutrient.



Worst Case/Alternate Case Scenario:  This facility has developed a worst-case and alternative-case scenario however it has bben withheld from this Executive Summary as security-sensitive information as requested by EPA.  



Accidental Release Program:  Effingham Equity complies with all rules and regulations relating to the storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia including the Illinois Department of Agriculture regulations as well as OSHA 29 cfr 1910.111.



Five-Year Accident History:  There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia at this facility in the past five years. 



Emergency Response Program:  Effingham Equity has a written emergency action plan in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.38.  Emergency planning and community right to know information is provided to the Illinois Emergency Management Agency, local emergency planning committee (LEPC) and local fire department as required by SARA Title III of EPCRA.  



Planned Changes to Improve Safety:  Safety improvement is an on-going process at this facility.  Periodic inspections and evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance of safe practices and operations.  There are no additional specific anydrous ammon
ia safety recommendations for implementation at this time.
